headline.print_headline: Panel Sees New Flaw in Energy Loans
headline.seo: House Panel to Cite New Flaw in Energy Loans
headline.main: House Panel to Cite New Flaw in Energy Loans

docs.snippet: An investigative committee is questioning whether projects met a mandate for innovation. The Energy Department defended the standard....

keywords.value: House Oversight and Government Reform Committee
keywords.name: organizations

docs.abstract: House Oversight and Government Reform Committee is set to release report arguing that the Energy Department overrode the objection of some staff members in order to pick aid recipients despite fact that their products were not actually innovative; supporters of the Energy Department said that there was no requirement that the loans be for novel technology, and that the department stuck to a standard adopted during the Bush administration requiring only that the projects use technology not yet commercialized in the United States.
docs.lead_paragraph: An investigative committee is questioning whether projects met a mandate for innovation. The Energy Department defended the standard.

headline.print_headline: Layup on Last Tick of the Clock Lifts St. John’s
headline.seo: Layup on Last Tick of the Clock Lifts St. John’s
headline.main: Layup on Last Tick of the Clock Lifts St. John’s
headline.kicker: Women's N.C.A.A. Tournament: St. John’s 69, Creighton 67

docs.snippet: Nadirah McKenith scored on a coast-to-coast layup with 0.1 of a second left, lifting third-seeded St. John’s to a 69-67 victory over Creighton on Sunday in the first round of the N.C.A.A. women’s tournament....
docs.abstract: St John's defeats Creighton, 69-67, in first round of NCAA women's basketball tournament; will face Oklahoma in second round.
docs.lead_paragraph: Nadirah McKenith scored on a coast-to-coast layup with 0.1 of a second left, lifting third-seeded St. John’s to a 69-67 victory over Creighton on Sunday in the first round of the N.C.A.A. women’s tournament.

headline.main: Al Jazeera Reporter's iPhone Documentary on the Syrian Uprising

docs.snippet: Al Jazeera aired a 25-minute, first-person video piece on the Syrian uprising, captured by an undercover correspondent. Despite the continuing violence, the reporter describes a hopeful defiance among Syrian protesters....
docs.abstract: Al Jazeera aired a 25-minute, first-person video piece on the Syrian uprising, captured by an undercover correspondent. Despite the continuing violence, the reporter describes a hopeful defiance among Syrian protesters.

headline.print_headline: Racial Lens Used to Cull Curriculum In Arizona
headline.seo: Racial Lens Used to Cull Curriculum in Arizona
headline.main: Racial Lens Used to Cull Curriculum in Arizona

docs.snippet: A state law targeting Mexican-American studies courses that are perceived as antiwhite has led to several books being pulled by the Tucson school district....
docs.abstract: Michael Winerip On Education column criticizes Arizona state law that targets Mexican-American studies in public schools; notes that law, which bans material related to 'critical race theory' and classes 'promoting racial resentment,' was enacted by state's Republican majority; recounts details of visit by banned author Matt de la Pena to one Tucson High School, where he donated 240 copies of his novel in protest of the legislation.
docs.lead_paragraph: A state law targeting Mexican-American studies courses that are perceived as antiwhite has led to several books being pulled by the Tucson school district.

headline.print_headline: As Illinois Primary Nears, G.O.P. Rivals Take Different Tacks: Romneys Court Women Alienated by Contraception Issue
headline.seo: Romneys Court Women Put Off by Contraception Debate
headline.main: Romneys Court Women Put Off by Birth Control Issue

docs.snippet: Mitt Romney and his wife, Ann, made an appeal on Sunday to women, a coveted group of swing voters who largely favored Rick Santorum over Mr. Romney in a recent poll....
docs.abstract: Mitt Romney and his wife, Ann, make an appeal to Illinois women in the lead-up to that state's primary, seeking to repair political damage that has alienated women throughout the Republican nominating contest; Ann's campaign role has grown significantly as Romney seeks to capture more independents and women who have been turned off by his hard-line stances on immigration and social issues.
docs.lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney and his wife, Ann, made an appeal on Sunday to women, a coveted group of swing voters who largely favored Rick Santorum over Mr. Romney in a recent poll.
